â€œAgain and again, great king,

â€œIn this very city,
I was in a certain family;
I was a servant,
a wage-earner, restrained by virtue.
As I was leaving for work,
I saw four ascetics;

Placing my faith in them,
sitting on a leaf mat;
I gave the Buddha a lump of sugar,
with a joyful heart.
By that wholesome deed,
this is the kind of fruit I have;
I enjoy this sovereignty,
this prosperous and excellent earth.â€
â€œGiving, enjoy, and be not heedless,
